inclusion.criterion: Diagnosis of acute appendicitis based on clinical, laboratory and/or radiologic criteria
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: CT scan showed evidence of acute perforated appendicitis with free fluid in the pelvis

exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: The pain is four days old

exclusion.criterion: Presence of an appendiceal abscess on imaging
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Clinical or laboratory suspicion of advanced appendicitis, peritonitis or perforation
exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: Diagnostic laparoscopy revealed phlegmon with no other abdominal abnormalities

exclusion.criterion: Inability or unwillingness to complete a 1-week course of oral antibiotics
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: The patient is a 17-year-old boy with severe migratory pain in the right lower quadrant of his abdomen, accompanied by nausea and vomiting. He has been diagnosed with acute perforated appendicitis.
